name: a201a

name: acriflavine

name: amikacin
notes: An aminoglycoside used to treat infections caused by more resistant strains of Gram negative bacteria and some Gram positive bacteria.

name: amoxicillin

name: amoxicillin and beta-lactamase inhibitor
notes: Combination of amoxicillin with a beta-lactamase inhibitor; used for infections caused by beta-lactamase–producing bacteria. DDD refers to the amoxicillin component.

name: ampicillin

name: ampicillin combinations

name: apramycin

name: arbekacin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as peptides. name: aspoxicillin
notes: An semisynthetic aminoglycoside antibiotic. Often used for treatment of multi-resistant bacterial infection such as methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA).

name: astromicin
notes: Astromicin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic that binds to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and inhibiting protein synthesis.

name: azidamfenicol
notes: Azidamfenicol is a water soluble derivative of chloramphenicol, sharing the same mode of action of inhibiting peptide synthesis by interacting with the 23S RNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit.

name: azidocillin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as penicillins. These are organic compounds containing the penicillin core structure, which is structurally characterized by a penam ring bearing two methyl groups at position 2, and an amide group at position 6 [starting from the sulfur atom at position 1].

name: azithromycin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as aminoglycosides. These are molecules or a portion of a molecule composed of amino-modified sugars.

name: azlocillin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as peptides. These are compounds containing an amide derived from two or more amino carboxylic acid molecules (the same or different) by formation of a covalent bond from the carbonyl carbon of one to the nitrogen atom of another.

name: aztreonam
notes: A beta-lactam antibiotic used to treat select aztreonam sensitive gram negative bacteria

name: bacampicillin
notes: An ampicillin prodrug used to treat various susceptible bacterial infections in the body, such as respiratory infections and skin and subcutaneous tissue infections.

name: bacitracin
notes: An antibiotic used to treat eye infections, skin infections, and lung infections in infants, and to prevent wound infections.

name: bacitracin a
notes: Bacitracin A is the primary component of bacitracin. It contains many uncommon amino acids and interferes with bacterial cell wall synthesis.

name: bacitracin b
notes: Bacitracin B is a component of bacitracin, an antibiotic mixture that interferes with bacterial cell wall synthesis. It differs from Bacitracin A with a valine instead of an isoleucine in its peptide.

name: bacitracin f
notes: Bacitracin F is a component of bacitracin, an antibiotic mixture that interferes with bacterial cell wall synthesis. It is formed when the thiazoline ring of bacitracin A is oxidatively deaminated.

name: bal30072
notes: BAL30072 is a monocyclic beta-lactam antibiotic belonging to the sulfactams. BAL30072 was found to trigger the spheroplasting and lysis of Escherichia coli rather than the formation of extensive filaments.

name: balofloxacin
notes: Balofloxacin is an 8-methoxy fluoroquinolone antibiotic that inhibits DNA gyrase supercoiling activity. Active against S. aureus, E. coli, and P. aeruginosa. Synonyms: Q-35. PubChem: 65958; ChEMBL: CHEMBL1210954; CAS: 127294-70-6.

name: bedaquiline
notes: Bedaquiline is a diarylquinoline antimycobacterial used in combination with other antibacterials to treat pulmonary multidrug resistant tuberculosis (MDR-TB).

name: bekanamycin
notes: An aminoglycoside antibiotic indicated in the treatment of eye infections

name: benzalkonium chloride
notes: An ingredient used as a preservative in medications or as a disinfectant in cleaning products.

name: benzylpenicillin

name: biapenem

name: bicyclomycin

name: butirosin

name: capreomycin

name: cefapirin

name: cefatrizine

name: cefazedone

name: cefazolin
notes: A broad-spectrum cephalosporin antibiotic mainly used for the treatment of skin bacterial infections and other moderate to severe bacterial infections in the lung, bone, joint, stomach, blood, heart valve, and urinary tract.

name: cefbuperazone

name: cefcapene
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as cephalosporin 3'-carbamates. These are cephalosporins that are substituted at the 3'-position by a carbamate group.

name: cefditoren

name: cefotiam
notes: A cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections.

name: cefoxitin
notes: A semi-synthetic, broad-spectrum antibiotic for parenteral administration used for the treatment of serious bacterial infections, such as urinary tract infection, blood infection, bone and joint infection, and lower respiratory tract infection.

name: cefprozil
notes: A cephalosporin antibiotic used in the treatment of various bacterial infections, such as pharyngitis, tonsillitis, otitis media, and uncomplicated skin infections.

name: cefradine
notes: A first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used in the treatment of bacterial infections of the respiratory and urinary tracts and of the skin and soft tissues.

name: cefroxadine

name: ceftaroline
notes: An antibacterial agent used to treat various bacterial infections, such as acute bacterial skin and skin structure infections and community-acquired bacterial pneumonia.

name: ceftaroline fosamil
notes: An antibiotic medication used to treat various bacterial infections, such as skin infections and certain types of pneumonia.

name: ceftazidime
notes: A injected broad-spectrum third-generation cephalosporin beta-lactam antibiotic used to treat or prevent a variety of bacterial infections, including pneumonia, gynecological infections, bone and joint infections, and septicemia, among others.

name: ceftezole
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as cephalosporins. These are compounds containing a 1,2-thiazine fused to a 2-azetidinone to for a oxo-5-thia-1-azabicyclo[4.2.0]oct-2-ene-2-carboxylic acid moiety or a derivative thereof.

name: ceftibuten
notes: A third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic commonly used in the treatment of acute bacterial exacerbations of chronic bronchitis (ABECB), acute bacterial otitis media, pharyngitis, and tonsillitis.

name: ceftiofur
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as cephalosporins. These are compounds containing a 1,2-thiazine fused to a 2-azetidinone to for a oxo-5-thia-1-azabicyclo[4.2.0]oct-2-ene-2-carboxylic acid moiety or a derivative thereof.

name: ceftizoxime
notes: Ceftizoxime is a third-generation cephalosporin and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Ceftizoxime causes bacterial cell lysis through peptidoglycan cross-linking inhibition by binding to PBPs.

name: ceftobiprole medocaril
notes: A broad spectrum 5th-generation cephalosporin antibacterial indicated for certain kinds of pneumonia, bacteremia, and skin and skin structure infections, including those caused by MRSA.

name: ceftolozane
notes: A cphalosporin antibiotic used to treat complicated intra-abdominal infections in combination with metronidazole, complicated urinary tract infections, and hospital-acquired pneumonia.

name: ceftolozane and beta-lactamase inhibitor
notes: P: 3 g; Refers to ceftolozane

name: ceftriaxone
notes: A broad-spectrum cephalosporin antibiotic used for the treatment of bacterial infections in various locations, such as in the respiratory tract, skin, soft tissue, and urinary tract

name: celesticetin
notes: An antibacterial agent that can inhibit the growth of S. acidocaldarius.

name: chalcomycin
notes: A macrolide antibiotic, which exhibits antimicrobial activities against gram-positive Staphylococcus aureus and Streptococcus pyogenes. Chalcomycin protects mice from infection with a variety of staphylococci and streptococc, without significant toxicity.

name: chloramphenicol
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as coumarin glycosides. These are aromatic compounds containing a carbohydrate moiety glycosidically bound to a coumarin moiety.

name: chlorhexidine
notes: Chlorhexidine is a disinfectant and antiseptic that is used for skin disinfection, including mouthwashes (chlorhexidine gluconate).

name: chlortetracycline
notes: The first tetracycline antibiotic most commonly used for veterinary purposes.

name: cinoxacin
notes: Cinoxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic primarily used for the treatment of urinary tract infections in adults. Cinoxacin binds to DNA gyrase, resulting in double-stranded DNA breaks and cell death.

name: ciprofloxacin
notes: A bacteriocidal fluoroquinolone. It blocks bacterial DNA replication by binding to the toposiomerase II or IV-DNA complex (or cleavable complex), thereby causing double-stranded breaks in the bacterial chromosome.

name: clarithromycin
notes: Clarithromycin is a methyl derivative of erythromycin, sharing the 14-carbon macrolide ring. The antibiotic binds to the 50S subunit of the ribosome and is used to treat pharyngitis, tonsillitis, acute maxillary sinusitis, acute bacterial exacerbation of chronic bronchitis, pneumonia (especially atypical pneumonias associated with Chlamydia pneumoniae or TWAR), and skin structure infections.

name: clindamycin
notes: Clindamycin is a lincosamide antibiotic that blocks A-site aminoacyl-tRNA binding. It is usually used to treat infections with anaerobic bacteria but can also be used to treat some protozoal diseases, such as malaria.

name: clofazimine
notes: A riminophenazine antimycobacterial used to treat leprosy.

name: clofoctol
notes: An antibacterial agent indicated in the treatment of respiratory infections; or prevention of infections after ear, nose, and throat surgery.

name: clometocillin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as n-acyl-alpha amino acids and derivatives. These are compounds containing an alpha amino acid (or a derivative thereof) which bears an acyl group at its terminal nitrogen atom.

name: clomocycline
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as tetracyclines. These are polyketides having an octahydrotetracene-2-carboxamide skeleton, substituted with many hydroxy and other groups.

name: clorobiocin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as coumarin glycosides. These are aromatic compounds containing a carbohydrate moiety glycosidically bound to a coumarin moiety.

name: cloxacillin
notes: An antibiotic agent used for the treatment of beta-hemolytic streptococcal and pneumococcal infections as well as staphylococcal infections.

name: dalbavancin

name: dalfopristin
notes: An antibiotic used with quinupristin to treat severe or life-threatening infections of vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus faecium (VREF), and skin infections caused by methicillin susceptible staphylococcus aureus or streptococcus pyogenes.

name: dapsone
notes: A sulfone drug used to treat acne vulgaris, Hansen's disease, and dermatitis herpetiformis.

name: daptomycin
notes: A cyclic lipopeptide antibiotic used to treat complicated skin and skin structure infections by susceptible Gram-positive bacteria and bacteremia due to Staphylococcus aureus.

name: defensin
notes: A Rabbit-derived and non-conjugated IgG monoclonal antibody, targeting to beta Defensin 1.

name: delafloxacin
notes: A fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat skin and skin structure infections.

name: delamanid
notes: An antibiotic used to treat multidrug resistant tuberculosis

name: demeclocycline
notes: A tetracycline antibiotic used to treat a wide variety of susceptible bacterial infections.

name: dibekacin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as 4,6-disubstituted 2-deoxystreptamines. These are 2-deoxystreptamine aminoglycosides that a glycosidically linked to a pyranose of furanose unit at the C4- and C6-positions.

name: dicloxacillin
notes: A penicillin used to treat penicillinase-producing bacterial infections that are susceptible to the drug.

name: dirithromycin
notes: An antibiotic used to treat a variety of respiratory, skin, and other infections.

name: doripenem
notes: An antibiotic of the penem class used to treat complicated intra-abdominal and urinary tract infections.

name: doxycycline
notes: A tracycline antibiotic used to treat a wide variety of bacterial infections.

name: edeine a
notes: A subtype of the peptide antibiotic edeine, composed of beta-tyr, beta-ser, diaminopropionic acid, diaminohydroxyazelaic acid, glycine, and spermidine.

name: edeine b
notes: A subtype of the peptide antibiotic edeine, composed of beta-tyr, beta-ser, diaminopropionic acid, diaminohydroxyazelaic acid, glycine, and guanylspermidine.

name: edeine d
notes: A subtype of edeine similar to edeine A with the beta-tyr replaced by beta-phe-beta-ala. Edeines bind to the 30S subunit to block fMet-tRNA interaction at the P site, inhibiting protein synthesis and subsequent structure/function processes critical for life or replication.

name: edeine f
notes: A subtype of edeine similar to edeine B with beta-tyr replaced by beta-phe-beta-ala.

name: enacyloxin iia
notes: A structurally distinct but acts in a similar mechanism to kirromycin-like elfamycins. It prohibits the transfer of the amino acid at the A site to the elongating peptide chain.

name: enrofloxacin
notes: A broad-spectrum fluoroquinolone antibiotic. It is used in veterinary medicine predominately for dogs and cats but is sometimes used for other animals.

name: enoxacin
notes: Enoxacin belongs to a group called fluoroquinolones. Its mode of action depends upon blocking bacterial DNA replication by binding itself to DNA gyrase and causing double-stranded breaks in the bacterial chromosome.

name: epicillin
notes: An extended-spectrum, semisynthetic aminopenicillin with antibacterial activity.

name: ethambutol
notes: An antimycobacterial drug prescribed to treat tuberculosis. It is usually given in combination with other tuberculosis drugs, such as isoniazid, rifampicin, and pyrazinamide. Ethambutol inhibits arabinosyl biosynthesis, disrupting mycobacterial cell wall formation.

name: ethionamide
notes: A medication used to treat tuberculosis (TB) when other treatments have not worked.

name: eravacycline
notes: An antibiotic used to treat some types of infections in the gut.

name: ertapenem
notes: An antibiotic used to treat various moderate to severe infections caused by certain bacteria.

name: erythromycin
notes: An antibiotic used to treat and prevent various infections caused by bacteria.

name: evernimicin
notes: A veterinary oligosaccharide antibiotic of the orthosomycin group of orthoester antibiotics. Along with avilamycin, it exhibits activity against a variety of Gram-positive and -negative bacteria and is primarily used in livestock feed.

name: factumycin
notes: A kirromycin-like antibiotic produced by Kitasatospora setae and Streptomyces strains. Its biosynthetic cluster has been characterized which has interesting acetyl transferase domains in trans, or outside of the polyketide synthase domains. Factumycin has specific, rather than broad spectrum, antibacterial properties, especially targeting various Acinetobacter baumanii strains.

name: faropenem
notes: An orally active beta-lactam antibiotic belonging to the penem group.

name: flomoxef
notes: An oxacephem antibiotic which was effective in preventing the growth of all ESBL-producing strains and is widely active against Gram-positive, Gram-negative, and anaerobic bacteria. It is sometimes classified as a second-generation or fourth-generation cephalosporin.

name: fleroxacin
notes: A broad spectrum fluoroquinolone antibiotic that inhibits the DNA supercoiling activity of bacterial DNA gyrase, resulting in double-stranded DNA breaks and subsequent cell death.

name: florfenicol
notes: A fluorine derivative of chloramphenicol, where the nitro group (-NO2) is substituted by a sulfomethyl group (-SO2CH3) and the hydroxyl group (-OH), by a fluorine group (-F).

name: flucloxacillin
notes: Similar to cloxacillin, with an extra additional fluorine atom.

name: flumequine
notes: A first generation fluoroquinolone antibiotic. It is used primarily for the treatment of enteric infections in domestic species. It has been removed from clinical use and is no longer being marketed.

name: flurithromycin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as aminoglycosides. These are molecules or a portion of a molecule composed of amino-modified sugars.

name: fosfomycin
notes: A broad-spectrum antibiotic produced by certain Streptomyces species. It is effective on gram positive and negative bacteria as it targets the cell wall, an essential feature shared by both bacteria. Its specific target is MurA (MurZ in E.coli), which attaches phosphoenolpyruvate (PEP) to UDP-N-acetylglucosamine, a step of commitment to cell wall synthesis. In the active site of MurA, the active cysteine molecule is alkylated which stops the catalytic reaction.

name: furazidin
notes: A nitrofuran derivative, acting as an antibacterial medicine with bacteriostatic action. It is active against both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria. It is used for the treatment of urinary tract, skin, and soft tissues infections.

name: fusidic acid
notes: The only commercially available fusidane, a group of steroid-like antibiotics. It is most active against Gram-positive bacteria, and acts by inhibiting elongation factor G to block protein synthesis.

name: g418
notes: A gentamicin class aminoglycoside antibiotic often used in mammalian cell culture work as a selectable marker for the neo cassette (APH3').

name: garenoxacin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as quinoline carboxylic acids. These are quinolines in which the quinoline ring system is substituted by a carboxyl group at one or more positions.

name: gatifloxacin
notes: An 8-methoxy, 7-piperazinyl, 6-fluoroquinolone that can be taken orally or by intravenous administration. It is active against most Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, but inactive against non-fermenting Gram-negative rods including Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: ge2270a
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as macrolactams. These are cyclic amides of amino carboxylic acids, having a 1-azacycloalkan-2-one structure, or analogues having unsaturation or heteroatoms replacing one or more carbon atoms of the ring. They are nitrogen analogues (the a nitrogen atom replacing the o atom of the cyclic carboxylic acid group ) of the naturally occurring macrolides.

name: gemifloxacin
notes: A broad-spectrum, fourth generation, oral fluoroquinolone antibiotic used in the treatment of various bacterial infections, primarily in the lungs. It has been discontinued for therapeutic use in the US over concerns of tendon and peripheral neuron toxicity, although it is still available for experimental application and elsewhere for therapeutic use. It is usually administered as a mesylate salt, gemifloxacin mesylate.

name: gentamicin
notes: Gentamicin is a commonly used aminoglycoside antibiotic derived from members of the Micromonospora genus of bacteria. It acts by binding the 30S ribosomal subunit, thus inhibiting protein synthesis. Gentamicin is typically used to treat Gram-negative infections of the repiratory and urinary tract, as well as infections of the bone and soft tissue.

name: gentamicin a
notes: A part of a complex of broad spectrum aminoglycoside antibiotics. Gentamicin inhibits protein synthesis, resulting in bacterial cell death.

name: gentamicin b
notes: A semisynthetic aminoglycoside antibacterial.

name: gentamicin c
notes: A mixture of gentamicin C1, gentamicin C1a, and gentamicin C2 (these differ in substituents at position C6'). Gentamicin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.

name: gepotidacin
notes: A triazaacenaphthylene bacterial type II topoisomerase inhibitor used experimentally. It has been in phase III of clinical trials since 2019 for the treatment of gonorrhea
column6: however gepotidacin has demonstrated antibiotic activity against a variety of bacteria."

name: grepafloxacin
notes: A broad-spectrum antibacterial quinoline. It is no longer taken due to its high toxicity.

name: griseoviridin
notes: A streptogramin A antibiotic.

name: hetacillin
notes: A semi-synthetic penicillin compound with bactericidal properties. Hetacillin is a prodrug that is converted to ampicillin via esterases.

name: hygromycin a
notes: An antibiotic produced by Streptomyces hygroscopicus. It inhibits translation by binding to the peptidyl transferase center on the large ribosomal subunit. This prevents the binding of aminoacyl-tRNA to the A-site. Not to confused with Hygromycin B, which is structurally distinct.

name: hygromycin b
notes: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Hygromycin B works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth. Hygromycin B has also been shown to interact with eukaryotic cells.

name: iboxamycin
notes: A fully synthetic lincosamide antibiotic. Like other lincosamides, it selectively targets the bacterial ribosome and prevents elongation of the peptide chain. Iboxamycin has been shown to be effective against bacterial strains otherwise resistant to licosamide antibiotics.

name: iclaprim
notes: A bactericidal compound that inhibits dihydrofolate reductase. It is used against clinically important Gram-positive pathogens, including methicillin-sensitive Staphylococcus aureus and methicillin-resistant S. aureus.

name: imipenem
notes: A broad-spectrum antibiotic and is usually taken with cilastatin, which prevents hydrolysis of imipenem by renal dehydropeptidase-I. It is resistant to hydrolysis by most other beta-lactamases. Notable exceptions are the KPC beta-lactamases and Ambler Class B enzymes.

name: imipenem and cilastatin
notes: A combination of broad-spectrum carbapenem antibiotics with the antibacterial activity of β -lactam drugs.

name: isepamicin
notes: A semi-synthetic derivative of gentamicin B (hydroxyamino propionyl genamicin B). It is modified to combat microbial inactivation and has a slightly larger spectrum of activity compared to other aminoglycosides, including Ser marcescens, Enterobacteria, and K pneumoniae.

name: isoniazid
notes: An organic compound that is the first-line anti tuberculosis medication in prevention and treatment. As a prodrug, it is activated by mycobacterial catalase-peroxidases such as M. tuberculosis KatG. Isoniazid inhibits mycolic acid synthesis, which prevents cell wall synthesis in mycobacteria.

name: josamycin
notes: A macrolide antibiotic from Streptomyces narbonensis subsp. josamyceticus. The drug has antimicrobial activity against a wide spectrum of pathogens.

name: kanamycin
notes: An antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections in many different parts of the body.

name: kanamycin a
notes: An antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections in many different parts of the body.

name: kasugamycin
notes: An unusual aminoglycoside because the cyclitol ring is not amino substituted; it was discovered as a fermentation product of Streptomyces kasugaensis.

name: kirromycin
notes: Also known as mocimycin, is the representative molecule of its own class of elfamycins which is composed of more than 10 analogs. Kirromycin binds to the domain 1,2 interface of elongation factor Tu.

name: kitasamycin
notes: A macrolide antibiotic and is produced by Streptoverticillium kitasatoense. The drug has antimicrobial activity against a wide spectrum of pathogens.

name: lascufloxacin
notes: A small molecule drug. The usage of the INN stem '-oxacin' in the name indicates that Lascufloxacin is a nalidixic acid derivative antibacterial. Lascufloxacin has a monoisotopic molecular weight of 439.17 Da.

name: latamoxef
notes: A broad- spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic similar in structure to the cephalosporins except for the substitution of an oxaazabicyclo moiety for the thiaazabicyclo moiety of certain cephalosporins. It has been proposed especially for the meningitides because it passes the blood-brain barrier and for anaerobic infections.

name: lefamulin
notes: A pleuromutilin antibacterial used to treat community-acquired bacterial pneumonia (CABP).

name: levofloxacin
notes: A fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat a wide variety of bacterial infections.

name: levonadifloxacin
notes: Levonadifloxacin is under investigation in clinical trial NCT03405064 (Comparative Study of Levonadifloxacin (IV and Oral) With Linezolid (IV and Oral) in Acute Bacterial Skin and Skin Structure Infections (ABSSSI)).

name: lff571
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as macrolactams. These are cyclic amides of amino carboxylic acids, having a 1-azacycloalkan-2-one structure, or analogues having unsaturation or heteroatoms replacing one or more carbon atoms of the ring. They are nitrogen analogues (the a nitrogen atom replacing the o atom of the cyclic carboxylic acid group ) of the naturally occurring macrolides.

name: lincomycin
notes: An antibiotic reserved for the treatment of serious infections, usually in patients who are allergic to penicillin.

name: linezolid
notes: An oxazolidinone antibiotic used to treat infections by susceptible strains of aerobic Gram-positive bacteria.

name: linoleic acid
notes: Linoleic acid is a polyunsaturated omega-6 fatty acid. Linoleic acid has been found to have antibacterial activity, particularly in inhibiting the growth of Gram-positive bacterial species.

name: lividomycin
notes: Aminoglycosidic antibiotics produced by Streptomyces lividus. They contain 2-amino-2,3-dideoxy-D-glucose.

name: lomefloxacin
notes: A difluoropiperazinyl quinolone, sharing similar activities with other fluoroquinolones. It is used to treat urinary tract infections. Relative to other fluoroquinolones, it has a longer half life and has higher serum concentrations.

name: loracarbef
notes: A second-generation cephalosporin (carbacephem) and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Loracarbef inhibits PBPs through binding, disrupting peptidoglycan cell wall cross-linkage and resulting in cell death.

name: lymecycline
notes: An antibiotic medication to treat acne and other infections.

name: lysocin e
notes: A drug which binds to menaquinone in the bacterial cell membrane. Binding of Lysocin to menaquinone facilitates lysis of the cell.

name: madumycin ii
notes: A streptogramin A antibiotic.

name: mafenide
notes: A sulfonamide used topically for treating burns.

name: mandelic acid
notes: An approved aromatic, alpha hydroxy acid 1. Mandelic acid is used as an ingredient in cosmetics and drug products applied topically.

name: mecillinam
notes: A broad-spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic that was semi-synthetically derived to have a different drug centre, being a 6-alpha-amidinopenicillanate instead of a 6-alpha-acylaminopenicillanate. Contrasting most beta-lactam drugs, mecillinam is most active against Gram-negative bacteria. It binds specifically to penicillin binding protein 2 (PBP2).

name: meropenem
notes: An ultra-broad spectrum injectable antibiotic used to treat a wide variety of infections, including meningitis and pneumonia. It is a beta-lactam and belongs to the subgroup of carbapenem, similar to imipenem and ertapenem.

name: meropenem and vaborbactam
notes: An antibiotic against nonfermenting Gram-negative clinical isolates, including Enterobacteriaceae isolates with resistant and carbapenemase genotypes.

name: metacycline
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as tetracyclines. These are polyketides having an octahydrotetracene-2-carboxamide skeleton, substituted with many hydroxy and other groups.

name: metampicillin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as penicillins. These are organic compounds containing the penicillin core structure, which is structurally characterized by a penam ring bearing two methyl groups at position 2, and an amide group at position 6 [starting from the sulfur atom at position 1].

name: methenamine
notes: An antibiotic drug used to treat and prevent bacterial infections in the urinary tract that is frequently recurring despite previous treatments.

name: methicillin
notes: Derived from penicillin to combat penicillin-resistance, methicillin is insensitive to beta-lactamases (also known as penicillinases) secreted by many penicillin-resistant bacteria. Methicillin is bactericidal, and acts by inhibiting the synthesis of the peptidoglycan layer of bacterial cell walls. The peptidoglycan layer is important for cell wall structural integrity, especially in Gram-positive organisms.

name: methymycin
notes: Produced by Streptomyces venezuelae ATCC 15439.

name: meticillin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as dipeptides. These are organic compounds containing a sequence of exactly two alpha-amino acids joined by a peptide bond.

name: metronidazole
notes: A nitroimidazole that is active against anaerobic bacteria and protozoa. It is not effective against aerobic bacteria. Nitroimidazoles act by oxidizing DNA causing strand breaks and cell death.

name: mezlocillin
notes: A penicillin derivative taken parenterally.

name: microcin j25
notes: A 21-residue peptide of 2.1 kDa natively produced by E. coli.

name: midecamycin
notes: A macrolide antibiotic used to treat a variety of infections caused by susceptible bacteria.

name: minocycline
notes: A second generation semi-synthetic derivative of the tetracycline group of antibiotics. It inhibits bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the 30S subunit of the bacterial ribosome and preventing the aminotransferase-tRNA from associating with the ribosome.

name: miocamycin
notes: A macrolide antibiotic that can be isolated from a culture broth of Streptomyces mycarofaciens. Miocamycin has antibacterial properties.

name: moenomycin a1
notes: A major component of moenomycin mixtures. It is produced by Streptomyces ghanaensis, S. bambergiensis, S. ederensis, and S. geysiriensis.

name: moxalactam
notes: broad spectrum cephalosporin (oxacephem) and beta-lactam antibiotic. Moxalactam binding to PBPs inhibits peptidoglycan cross-linkage in the cell wall, resulting in cell death. Moxalactam is proposed to be effective against meningitides as it passes the blood-brain barrier.

name: moxifloxacin
notes: A fourth generation synthetic fluoroquinolone chemotherapeutic agent, and has been shown to be significantly more active than levofloxacin (4 to 8 times more) against Streptococcus pneumoniae. It acts by inhibiting bacterial DNA topoisomerases.

name: mupirocin
notes: Also known as pseudomonic acid, is a bacteriostatic polyketide antibiotic from Pseudomonas fluorescens used to treat S. aureus and MRSA. It inhibits Ile tRNA synthetase.

name: nafcillin
notes: A penicillin-class narrow-spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. It inhibits cell wall synthesis and peptidoglycan cross-linkage through binding to PBPs, similarly to other penicillin-like antibiotics.

name: nalidixic acid
notes: A quinolone derivative of naphthyridine active against many enterobacteria, but ineffective against Ps aeruginosa, Gram-positive bacteria, and anaerobes. Acquired resistance is common in nalidixic acid treatments.

name: narbomycin
notes: Produced by Streptomyces narbonensis.

name: nemonoxacin
notes: A C-8-methoxy non-fluorinated quinolone exhibiting potent antibacterial activities against Gram-positive, including MRSA and fluoroquinolone-resistant MRSA, Gram-negative, and atypical pathogens, especially methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus.

name: neomycin
notes: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Neomycin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.

name: netilmicin
notes: Netilmicin is an aminoglycoside used to treat a wide variety of infections in the body.

name: niddamycin
notes: A macrolide antibiotic, binds 50S ribosomal subunits to inhibit protein synthesis.

name: nifurtoinol
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as hydantoins. These are heterocyclic compounds containing an imidazolidine substituted by ketone group at positions 2 and 4.

name: nitrofurantoin
notes: An antibiotic used to treat urinary tract infections. It inhibits enzyme synthesis by inhibiting essential enzymes involved in the citric acid cycle, as well as those involved in DNA, RNA, and protein synthesis. It is marketed under the following brand names: Furadantin, Macrobid, Macrodantin, Nitro Macro and Urantoin.

name: nitrofurantoin combinations
notes: combinations

name: nitroxoline
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as nitroquinolines and derivatives. These are compounds containing a nitro group attached to a quinoline moiety.

name: norfloxacin
notes: A 6-fluoro, 7-piperazinyl quinolone with a wide range of activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It is inactive against most anaerobes.

name: novobiocin
notes: An aminocoumarin antibiotic produced by Streptomyces spheroides and Streptomyces niveus, and binds DNA gyrase subunit B inhibiting ATP-dependent DNA supercoiling.

name: ofloxacin
notes: 6-fluoro, 7-piperazinyl quinolone with a methyl-substituted oxazine ring. It has a broad spectrum of activity including many enterobacteria and mycoplasma but most anaerobes are resistant.

name: oleandomycin
notes: A 14-membered macrolide produced by Streptomyces antibioticus. It is ssimilar to erythromycin, and contains a desosamine amino sugar and an oleandrose sugar. It targets the 50S ribosomal subunit to prevent protein synthesis.

name: oleic acid
notes: A fatty acid added to many products for its ability to prevent bacterial growth.

name: omadacycline
notes: An aminomethylcycline antibiotic that targets 16s rRNA in gram positive and gram negative bacteria.

name: ornidazole
notes: A synthetic nitroimidazole derivative mainly used to treat parasitic infections but has also demonstrated antibiotic activity against anaerobic bacteria.

name: oritavancin
notes: A semi-synthetic derivative of chloroeremomycin, a vancomycin-like glycopeptide. Oritavancin inhibits both transglycosylation and transpeptidation, by binding both the D-Ala-D-Ala and pentaglycine bridge segments of peptidoglycan to inhibit cell wall formation.

name: ostreogrycin b3
notes: Ostreogrycin B3 has anti-Gram positive bacterial activity

name: oxacillin
notes: A penicillinase-resistant beta-lactam. It is similar to methicillin, and has replaced methicillin in clinical use. Oxacillin, especially in combination with other antibiotics, is effective against many penicillinase-producing strains of Staphylococcus aureus and Staphylococcus epidermidis.

name: oxolinic acid
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as quinoline carboxylic acids. These are quinolines in which the quinoline ring system is substituted by a carboxyl group at one or more positions.

name: oxytetracycline
notes: A derivative of tetracycline with a 5-hydroxyl group. Its activity is similar to other tetracyclines.

name: pactamycin
notes: Antibiotic produced by Streptomyces pactum, considered a universal translation inhibitor.

name: palmitic acid
notes: A chemical added to packaged foods to preserve them and added to cosmetic products to clean or moisturize the skin.

name: panipenem
notes: Panipenem is a carbapenem antibacterial agent with a broad spectrum of in vitro activity covering a wide range of Gram-negative and Gram-positive aerobic and anaerobic bacterial. It is used in combination with betamipron to inhibit panipenem uptake into the renal tubule and prevent nephrotoxicity.

name: panipenem and betamipron
notes: P: 2 g; Refers to panipenem

name: para-aminosalicylic acid
notes:
An aminosalicylate drug used to induce remission in ulcerative colitis.'

name: patricin a
notes: A streptogramin B antibiotic.

name: patricin b
notes: A streptogramin B antibiotic.

name: pazufloxacin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as quinoline carboxylic acids. These are quinolines in which the quinoline ring system is substituted by a carboxyl group at one or more positions.

name: pefloxacin
notes: Pefloxacin is structurally and functionally similar to norfloxacin. It is poorly active against mycobacteria, while anaerobes are resistant.

name: perchlozone
notes: A novel thiosemicarbazone used for the treatment of multidrug-resistant tuberculosis. It is similar to thiacetazone with only a different side chain attached to the thiosemicarbazone moiety. Perchlozone is a prodrug that is activated by ethA and inhibits the HadABC complex.

name: penamecillin
notes: Penamecillin is a semisynthetic derivative penicillanic acid ester that is the acetoxymethyl ester of benzylpenicillin. It is a prodrug for benzylpenicillin with antibacterial activity.

name: penimepicycline
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as tetracyclines. These are polyketides having an octahydrotetracene-2-carboxamide skeleton, substituted with many hydroxy and other groups.

name: pentisomicin
notes: Pentisomicin is a semisynthetic aminoglycoside antibiotic similar to sisomicin.

name: pheneticillin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as dipeptides. These are organic compounds containing a sequence of exactly two alpha-amino acids joined by a peptide bond.

name: phenoxymethylpenicillin
notes: Phenoxymethylpenicillin, or penicillin V, is a penicillin derivative that is acid stable but less active than benzylpenicillin (penicillin G).

name: pikromycin
notes: A macrolide antibiotic that has been found in S. venezuelae and active against E. coli, S. aureus and B. subtilis.

name: pipemidic acid
notes: A quinolone antibiotic indicated in the treatment of susceptible urinary tract infections.

name: piperacillin
notes: An acetylureidopenicillin and has an extended spectrum of targets relative to other beta-lactam antibiotics. It inhibits cell wall synthesis in bacteria, and is usually taken with the beta-lactamase inhibitor tazobactam to overcome penicillin-resistant bacteria.

name: pirlimycin
notes: Pirlimycin is an experimental/veterinary lincosamide antibiotic. Although not approved for use in humans, pirlimycin is commonly used to treat mammary gland infections in cattle.

name: piromidic acid
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as pyrido[2,3-d]pyrimidines. These are compounds containing the pyrido[2,3-d]pyrimidine ring system, which is a pyridopyrimidine isomer with three ring nitrogen atoms at the 1-, 3-, and 8- position.

name: pivampicillin
notes: Pivampicillin is a semisynthetic, orally active pivalate ester of ampicillin with antibacterial activity.

name: pivmecillinam
notes: Pivmecillinam, the oral prodrug of the antimicrobial active agent mecillinam, is a bona fide agent for uncomplicated lower urinary tract infections (UTIs), because of its selectivity and effect against several species of Enterobacteriaceae.

name: plazomicin
notes: Plazomicin is a neoglycoside, or next-generation, aminoglycoside, that has been identified as a potentially useful agent to combat drug-resistant bacteria, such as Acinetobacter baumannii and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: pleuromutilin
notes: Pleuromutilin is a natural product antibiotic produced by Clitopilus passeckerianus. Related antibiotics of clinical significance, such as tiamulin and retapamulin, are semi-synthetic derivatives of this compound.

name: polymyxin B
notes: Polymyxin B is a polymyxin antibiotic used to treat a wide variety of infections in the body.

name: polymyxin B1
notes: Polymyxin B1 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with a 6-methyloctanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.

name: polymyxin B2
notes: Polymyxin B2 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with a 6-methylheptanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.

name: polymyxin B3
notes: Polymyxin B3 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with an octanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.

name: polymyxin B4
notes: Polymyxin B4 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with a heptanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.

name: pretomanid
notes: Pretomanid is an antibiotic medication used for the treatment of multi-drug-resistant tuberculosis affecting the lungs.

name: pristinamycin
notes: An orally active streptogramin-like antibiotic consisting of two chemically unrelated components: Pristinamycin I (PI) and Pristinamycin II (PII).

name: pristinamycin ia
notes: Pristinamycin IA is a type B streptogramin antibiotic produced by Streptomyces pristinaespiralis. It binds to the P site of the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome, preventing the extension of protein chains.

name: pristinamycin ib
notes: Pristinamycin IB is a class B streptogramin similar to pristinamycin IA, the former containing a N-methyl-4-(methylamino)phenylalanine instead of a N-methyl-4-(dimethylamino)phenylalanine in its class A streptogramin counterpart (one less methyl group).

name: pristinamycin ic
notes: Pristinamycin IC is a class B streptogramin derived from virginiamycin S1.

name: procaine benzylpenicillin
notes: A medication injected into the muscle that contains an anesthetic (a chemical that reduces pain) and an antibiotic to treat various infections in the body.

name: propicillin
notes: Propicillin is an orally taken penicillin derivative that has high absorption but poor activity.

name: prothionamide/protionamide
notes: Prothionamide is a thioamide derivative with antibacterial properties. It increases cell wall permeability and decreases cell wall damage resistance by inhibition of mycolic acid synthesis, resulting in cell death. It is particularly used to treat M. tuberculosis and M. leprae infections.

name: prulifloxacin
notes: Prulifloxacin is a 6-fluoroquinolone antibiotic with a C-2 sulfur atom. It is hydrolyzed by esterases to produce the active compound Ulifloxacin. The active compound has broad spectrum activity against most Gram-negative bacteria. Prulifloxacin displays strong bactericidal activity against Pseudomonas aeruginosa biofilms and persister cells.

name: pulvomycin
notes: Pulvomycin is a polyketide antibiotic that binds elongation factor Tu (EF-Tu) to inhibit protein biosynthesis by preventing the formation of the ternary complex (EF-Tu*GTP*aa-tRNA). Phenotypically, it was shown that pulvomycin sensitivity is dominant over resistance.

name: puromycin
notes: Puromycin is an aminonucleoside antibiotic, derived from Streptomyces alboniger, that causes premature chain termination during ribosomal protein translation.

name: pyrazinamide
notes: Pyrazinamide is an antimycobacterial. It is highly specific and active only against Mycobacterium tuberculosis. This compound is a prodrug and needs to be activated inside the cell. It interferes with the bacterium's ability to synthesize new fatty acids, causing cell death.

name: quinupristin
notes: Quinupristin is a type B streptogramin and a semisynthetic derivative of pristinamycin 1A. It is a component of the drug Synercid and interacts with the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome to inhibit protein synthesis.

name: quinupristin-dalfopristin
notes: An antibiotic cocktail of the streptogramin A dalfopristin and the streptogramin B quinupristin antibiotics. Used particularly to treat MRSA and vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus.

name: retapamulin
notes: Retapamulin is a semi-synthetic pleuromutilin antibiotic approved for the treatment of skin infections

name: ribostamycin
notes: Ribostamycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Ribostamycin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.

name: rifabutin
notes: Rifabutin is a semisynthetic rifamycin used in tuberculosis therapy. It inhibits DNA-dependent RNA synthesis.

name: rifampin
notes: Rifampin is a semi-synthetic rifamycin, and inhibits RNA synthesis by binding to RNA polymerase. Rifampin is the mainstay agent for the treatment of tuberculosis, leprosy and complicated Gram-positive infections.

name: rifapentine
notes: Rifapentine is a semisynthetic rifamycin that inhibits DNA-dependent RNA synthesis. It is often used in the treatment of tuberculosis and leprosy.

name: A07AA/D06AX
drug_class_id: Rifaximin is a semi-synthetic rifamycin used to treat traveller's diarrhea. Rifaximin inhibits RNA synthesis by binding to the beta subunit of bacterial RNA polymerase.

name: rokitamycin
notes: Rokitamycin is a macrolide antibiotic. Synthesized from strains of Streptomyces kitasatoensis.

name: rolitetracycline
notes: An antibiotic used in uncommon cases where high concentrations of antibiotic are needed.

name: rosoxacin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as quinoline carboxylic acids. These are quinolines in which the quinoline ring system is substituted by a carboxyl group at one or more positions.

name: roxithromycin
notes: Roxithromycin is a semi-synthetic, 14-carbon ring macrolide antibiotic derived from erythromycin. It is used to treat respiratory tract, urinary and soft tissue infections. Roxithromycin may possess bacteriocidal activity, particularly at higher concentrations by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial 70S rRNA complex, protein synthesis and subsequently structure/function processes critical for life or replication are inhibited.

name: rufloxacin
notes: Rufloxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic indicated in the treatment of susceptible respiratory infections and uncomplicated cystitis.

name: sarecycline
notes: Sarecycline is a tetracycline derivative.

name: sisomicin
notes: Sisomicin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Sisomicin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.

name: sitafloxacin
notes: Sitafloxacin is a fluoroquinolone active against multi-resistant Gram-positive and negative pathogens. Sitafloxacin shows inhibitory activity against DNA gyrase and topoisomerase IV, which blocks bacterial DNA replication, thereby causing double-stranded breaks in the bacterial chromosome.

name: solithromycin
notes: A clinically developed Macrolide antibiotic targeting gram positive and gram negative bacteria.

name: sparfloxacin
notes: Sparfloxacin is a dimethylpiperazinyl difluoroquinolone that acts by inhibiting DNA gyrase. It is active against aerobic Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, as well as some mycobacteria. It has moderate activity against some anaerobes.

name: spectinomycin
notes: Spectinomycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Spectinomycin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit inhibiting translation.

name: spiramycin
notes: Spiramycin is a 16-membered macrolide and is natural product produced by Streptomyces ambofaciens. It binds to the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes and inhibits peptidyl transfer activity to disrupt protein synthesis.

name: streptoduocin
notes: A small molecule drug and has 1 investigational indication.

name: streptomycin
notes: Streptomycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Streptomycin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.

name: streptothricin
notes: Streptothricins are a group of N-glycoside antibiotics that include a carbamoylated D-glucosamine to which are attached a series of L-beta-lysine residues at position 2 and a streptolidine at position 1. Streptothricins vary by the number of beta-lysine residues (from 1 (nourseothricin) to 7) and target protein synthesis in bacteria and eukaryotes.

name: sulbactam
notes: Sulbactam is an inhibitor of non-AmpC serine beta-lactamases.

name: sulbenicillin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as n-acyl-alpha amino acids and derivatives. These are compounds containing an alpha amino acid (or a derivative thereof) which bears an acyl group at its terminal nitrogen atom.

name: sulfacetamide
notes: Sulfacetamide is a very soluable sulfonamide antibiotic previously used to treat urinary tract infections. Its relatively low activity and toxicity to those with Stevens-Johnson syndrome have reduced its use and availability.

name: sulfadiazine
notes: Sulfadiazine is a potent inhibitor of dihydropteroate synthase, interfering with the tetrahydrofolic biosynthesis pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor to many nucleotides and amino acids.

name: sulfadimidine
notes: Sulfadimidine is an alkaline sulfonamide antibiotic that inhibits dihydropteroate synthase, and enzyme in the tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthesis pathway. This interferes with the production of folate, which is a precursor to many amino acids and nucleotides.

name: sulfadoxine
notes: Sulfadoxine is an inhibitor of dihydropteroate synthase, interfering with the tetrahydrofolic biosynthesis pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor to many nucleotides and amino acids.

name: sulfafurazole
notes: An antibiotic medication used with other antibiotics to prevent and treat a variety of infections in the body.

name: sulfaisodimidine
notes: Sulfaisodimidine also called sulfisomidine is an antibacterial product that has been studied for the treatment of urinary tract infections in the 1950s, however, it is unclear whether this drug has been officially approved for use anywhere.

name: sulfalene
notes: An antibiotic medication used to treat and prevent infections.

name: sulfamazone
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenylpyrazoles. These are compounds containing a phenylpyrazole skeleton, which consists of a pyrazole bound to a phenyl group.

name: sulfamerazine
notes: Sulfamerazine is a sulfonamide anti-infective used to treat bacterial infections, such as bronchitis, prostatitis, and urinary tract infections.

name: sulfamerazine and trimethoprim
notes: Sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim combination is used to treat infections including urinary tract infections, middle ear infections (otitis media), bronchitis, traveler's diarrhea, and shigellosis (bacillary dysentery).

name: sulfamethizole
notes: Sulfamethizole is a short-acting sulfonamide that inhibits dihydropteroate synthetase.

name: sulfamethoxazole
notes: Sulfamethoxazole is a sulfonamide antibiotic usually taken with trimethoprim, a diaminopyrimidine antibiotic. Sulfamethoxazole inhibits dihydropteroate synthase, essential to tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthesis. This pathway generates compounds used in the synthesis of many amino acids and nucleotides.

name: sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim
notes: Sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim combination is used to treat infections including urinary tract infections, middle ear infections (otitis media), bronchitis, traveler's diarrhea, and shigellosis (bacillary dysentery).

name: sulfamethoxypyridazine
notes: A sulphonamide antibiotic indicated in the treatment of gonorrhea, inflammation, urinary tract ulcers, and bronchitis.

name: sulfametomidine
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as aminobenzenesulfonamides. These are organic compounds containing a benzenesulfonamide moiety with an amine group attached to the benzene ring.

name: sulfametoxydiazine

name: sulfanilamide

name: sulfaphenazole
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenylpyrazoles. These are compounds containing a phenylpyrazole skeleton, which consists of a pyrazole bound to a phenyl group.

name: sulfapyridine
notes: An antibiotic used to treat certain skin conditions.

name: sulfasalazine
notes: Sulfasalazine is a derivative of the early sulfonamide sulfapyridine (salicylazosulfapyridine). It was developed to increase water solubility and is taken orally for ulcerative colitis.

notes: A mutual prodrug of ampicillin and sulbactam useful in the treatment of infections caused by beta-lactamase-producing bacteria.

name: talampicillin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as penicillins. These are organic compounds containing the penicillin core structure, which is structurally characterized by a penam ring bearing two methyl groups at position 2, and an amide group at position 6 [starting from the sulfur atom at position 1].

name: tazobactam
notes: Tazobactam is a compound which inhibits the action of bacterial beta-lactamases.

name: tebipenem pivoxil
notes: A carbapenem antibiotic, administered as the oral drug tebipenem-pivoxil, shown to be effective at treating bacterial infections.

name: tedizolid
notes: Tedizolid is a synthetic oxazolidinone antibiotic that is administered to the patient as a prodrug that is activated in vivo. It acts as an inhibitor of protein synthesis by binding the 50S subunit of the ribosome and preventing formation of the 70S initiation complex. It is active against Gram-positive pathogens.

name: teicoplanin
notes: Teicoplanin is a glycopeptide antibiotic used in the prophylaxis and treatment of serious infections caused by Gram-positive bacteria. Teicoplanin has a unique acyl-aliphatic chain, and binds to cell wall precursors to inhibit transglycosylation and transpeptidation.

name: telavancin
notes: Telavancin is a semi-synthetic derivative of vancomycin and is a second-generation lipoglycopeptide antibiotic. Telavancin inhibits cell wall synthesis by forming a complex with the D-Ala-D-Ala terminus of peptidoglycan precursors and preventing transglycosylation.

name: telithromycin
notes: Telithromycin is a semi-synthetic derivative of erythromycin. It is a 14-membered macrolide and is the first ketolide antibiotic to be used in clinics. Telithromycin binds the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome to inhibit protein synthesis.

name: temafloxacin
notes: Temafloxacin is an antibiotic agent belonging to the fluoroquinolone drug class. It was first approved for use in the U.S. market in 1992, but was withdrawn shortly due to the reports of serious adverse reactions, such as allergic reactions and hemolyric anemia, resulting in three deaths.

name: temocillin
notes: Temocillin has been investigated in Infection, Liver Dysfunction, and Urinary Tract Infection.

name: tetracycline
notes: Tetracycline is a broad-spectrum polyketide antibiotic produced by many Streptomyces. It works by inhibiting action of the prokaryotic 30S ribosome.

name: thiamphenicol
notes: Derivative of Chloramphenicol. The nitro group (-NO2) is substituted by a sulfomethyl group (-SO2CH3).

name: thiostrepton
notes: Thiostrepton is a cyclic peptide active against Gram-positive bacteria. It is produced by streptomyces bacteria.

name: tiamulin
notes: Tiamulin is a pleuromutilin derivative currently used in veterinary medicine. It binds to the 23 rRNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit to inhibit protein translation.

name: ticarcillin
notes: Ticarcillin is a carboxypenicillin used for the treatment of Gram-negative bacteria, particularly P. aeruginosa. Ticarcillin's antibiotic properties arise from its ability to prevent cross-linking of peptidoglycan during cell wall synthesis, when the bacteria try to divide, causing cell death.

name: tigecycline
notes: Tigecycline is an glycylcycline antibiotic. It works by inhibiting action of the prokaryotic 30S ribosome.

name: tilmicosin
notes: Tilmicosin is a macrolide antibiotic used for livestock and poultry synthesized from tylomycin. It is mainly used to treat common bacterial infections and diseases caused by mycoplasma infection in livestock and poultry breeding. Tilmicosin has broad-spectrum antibacterial properties and has a strong inhibitory effect on most Gram positive and negative bacteria.

name: tinidazole
notes: Tinidazole is a nitroimidazole anti-parasitic drug. It is used in the treatment of protozoan infections.

name: tobramycin
notes: Tobramycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Tobramycin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.

name: tosufloxacin
notes: Tosufloxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic with an extended spectrum of activity

name: triclosan
notes: Triclosan is a common antibacterial agent added to many consumer products as a biocide. It is an inhibitor of fatty acid biosynthesis by blocking enoyl-carrier protein reductase (FabI).

name: trimethoprim
notes: Trimethoprim is a synthetic 5-(3,4,5- trimethoxybenzyl) pyrimidine inhibitor of dihydrofolate reductase, inhibiting synthesis of tetrahydrofolic acid. Tetrahydrofolic acid is an essential precursor in the de novo synthesis of the DNA nucleotide thymidine. Trimethoprim is a bacteriostatic antibiotic mainly used in the prophylaxis and treatment of urinary tract infections in combination with sulfamethoxazole, a sulfonamide antibiotic.

name: trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole
notes: An active compound for toxoplasmic encephalitis inhibition, as well as inhibition in protozoan and bacterial infections.

name: troleandomycin
notes: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as aminoglycosides. These are molecules or a portion of a molecule composed of amino-modified sugars.

name: trovafloxacin
notes: Trovafloxacin is a trifluoroquinalone with a broad spectrum of activity that acts by inhibiting the uncoiling of supercoiled DNA. While potent against many Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, it is less active against pseudomonads and Cl. difficile. It is usually taken as the prodrug trovafloxacin mesylate or alatrofloxacin mesylate for oral or intravenous administration, respectively.

name: tunicamycin
notes: Tunicamycin is mixture of homologous nucleoside antibiotics that block the reaction of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine and dolichyl phosphate in the first step of glycoprotein synthesis.

name: tylosin
notes: Tylosin is a 16-membered macrolide, naturally produced by Streptomyces fradiae. It interacts with the bacterial ribosome 50S subunit to inhibit protein synthesis.

name: valnemulin
notes: Two semi-synthetic pleuromutilin derivatives, tiamulin and valnemulin, have been developed as antibiotics for veterinary use.

name: vancomycin
notes: Vancomycin is a glycopeptide antibiotic used in the prophylaxis and treatment of infections caused by Gram-positive bacteria. Vancomycin inhibits the synthesis of peptidoglycan, the major component of the cell wall of gram-positive bacteria. Its mechanism of action is unusual in that it acts by binding precursors of peptidoglycan, rather than by interacting with an enzyme.

name: vernamycin c
notes: Vernamycin C is a streptogramin B antibiotic.

name: viomycin
notes: Viomycin is a tuberactinomycin antibiotic that was used to treat Mycobacterium tuberculosis until it was replaced by the less toxic capreomycin. These drugs bind RNA in bacterial ribosomes and inhibit protein synthesis. Viomycin was derived from the actinomycete Streptomyces puniceus.

name: virginiamycin m1
notes: Virginiamycin M1 is a streptogramin A antibiotic.

name: virginiamycin s2
notes: Virginiamycin S2 is a streptogramin B antibiotic.

name: xibornol
notes: A lipophilic antiseptic indicated as an adjunct in the treatment of susceptible oral infections.

name: zoliflodacin
notes: Experimental antibiotic in phase two trial for Neisseria gonorrhoeae treatment.
